paragraphs.content: Chapter 5
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 5

paragraphs.content: Be ye therefore followers of God, as dear children;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Be ye therefore followers of God, as dear children;

paragraphs.content: And walk in love, as Christ also hath loved us, and hath given himself for us an offering and a sacrifice to God for a sweetsmelling savour.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And walk in love, as Christ also hath loved us, and hath given himself for us an offering and a sacrifice to God for a sweetsmelling savour.

paragraphs.content: But fornication, and all uncleanness, or covetousness, let it not be once named among you, as becometh saints;
paragraphs.contentHtml: But fornication, and all uncleanness, or covetousness, let it not be once named among you, as becometh saints;

paragraphs.content: Neither filthiness, nor foolish talking, nor jesting, which are not convenient: but rather giving of thanks.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Neither filthiness, nor foolish talking, nor jesting, which are not convenient: but rather giving of thanks.

paragraphs.content: For this ye know, that no whoremonger, nor unclean person, nor covetous man, who is an idolater, hath any inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For this ye know, that no whoremonger, nor unclean person, nor covetous man, who is an idolater, hath any inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God.

paragraphs.content: Let no man deceive you with vain words: for because of these things cometh the wrath of God upon the children of disobedience.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let no man deceive you with vain words: for because of these things cometh the wrath of God upon the children of disobedience.

paragraphs.content: Be not ye therefore partakers with them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Be not ye therefore partakers with them.

paragraphs.content: For ye were sometimes darkness, but now are ye light in the Lord: walk as children of light:
paragraphs.contentHtml: For ye were sometimes darkness, but now are ye light in the Lord: walk as children of light:

paragraphs.content: (For the fruit of the Spirit is in all goodness and righteousness and truth;)
paragraphs.contentHtml: (For the fruit of the Spirit is in all goodness and righteousness and truth;)

paragraphs.content: Proving what is acceptable unto the Lord.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Proving what is acceptable unto the Lord.

paragraphs.content: And have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness, but rather reprove them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness, but rather reprove them.

paragraphs.content: For it is a shame even to speak of those things which are done of them in secret.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For it is a shame even to speak of those things which are done of them in secret.

paragraphs.content: But all things that are reproved are made manifest by the light: for whatsoever doth make manifest is light.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But all things that are reproved are made manifest by the light: for whatsoever doth make manifest is light.

paragraphs.content: Wherefore he saith, Awake thou that sleepest, and arise from the dead, and Christ shall give thee light.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wherefore he saith, Awake thou that sleepest, and arise from the dead, and Christ shall give thee light.

paragraphs.content: See then that ye walk circumspectly, not as fools, but as wise,
paragraphs.contentHtml: See then that ye walk circumspectly, not as fools, but as wise,

paragraphs.content: Redeeming the time, because the days are evil.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Redeeming the time, because the days are evil.

paragraphs.content: Wherefore be ye not unwise, but understanding what the will of the Lord is.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wherefore be ye not unwise, but understanding what the will of the Lord is.

paragraphs.content: And be not drunk with wine, wherein is excess; but be filled with the Spirit;
paragraphs.contentHtml: And be not drunk with wine, wherein is excess; but be filled with the Spirit;

paragraphs.content: Speaking to yourselves in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and making melody in your heart to the Lord;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Speaking to yourselves in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and making melody in your heart to the Lord;

paragraphs.content: Giving thanks always for all things unto God and the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Giving thanks always for all things unto God and the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ;

paragraphs.content: Submitting yourselves one to another in the fear of God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Submitting yourselves one to another in the fear of God.

paragraphs.content: Wives, submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as unto the Lord.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wives, submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as unto the Lord.

paragraphs.content: For the husband is the head of the wife, even as Christ is the head of the church: and he is the saviour of the body.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the husband is the head of the wife, even as Christ is the head of the church: and he is the saviour of the body.

paragraphs.content: Therefore as the church is subject unto Christ, so let the wives be to their own husbands in every thing.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore as the church is subject unto Christ, so let the wives be to their own husbands in every thing.

paragraphs.content: Husbands, love your wives, even as Christ also loved the church, and gave himself for it;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Husbands, love your wives, even as Christ also loved the church, and gave himself for it;

paragraphs.content: That he might sanctify and cleanse it with the washing of water by the word,
paragraphs.contentHtml: That he might sanctify and cleanse it with the washing of water by the word,

paragraphs.content: That he might present it to himself a glorious church, not having spot, or wrinkle, or any such thing; but that it should be holy and without blemish.
paragraphs.contentHtml: That he might present it to himself a glorious church, not having spot, or wrinkle, or any such thing; but that it should be holy and without blemish.

paragraphs.content: So ought men to love their wives as their own bodies. He that loveth his wife loveth himself.
paragraphs.contentHtml: So ought men to love their wives as their own bodies. He that loveth his wife loveth himself.

paragraphs.content: For no man ever yet hated his own flesh; but nourisheth and cherisheth it, even as the Lord the church:
paragraphs.contentHtml: For no man ever yet hated his own flesh; but nourisheth and cherisheth it, even as the Lord the church:

paragraphs.content: For we are members of his body, of his flesh, and of his bones.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For we are members of his body, of his flesh, and of his bones.

paragraphs.content: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and shall be joined unto his wife, and they two shall be one flesh.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and shall be joined unto his wife, and they two shall be one flesh.

paragraphs.content: This is a great mystery: but I speak concerning Christ and the church.
paragraphs.contentHtml: This is a great mystery: but I speak concerning Christ and the church.

paragraphs.content: Nevertheless let every one of you in particular so love his wife even as himself; and the wife see that she reverence her husband.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Nevertheless let every one of you in particular so love his wife even as himself; and the wife see that she reverence her husband.
